name: Green and Red
desc: Be conscious about what you eat for a week, and see if it makes a difference
instructions: Each time you eat, for every day of the week, has to have some green and red BEFORE anything else

tasks.name: Upload a picture of what you eat

blocks.content: Please upload a picture of your meal today. We will then roughly estimate how much green and red you have eaten. If incorrect, you can correct the estimations

blocks.label: How do you feel today relative to yesterday?
Where did you do this experiment today?
Who did you do this experiment with today?
blocks.help: We encourage you to do experiments with someone you know

blocks.label: Did you do this experiment indoors or outdoors today?

name: Walking and Breathing
desc: Try exercising in a certain way for a week, and see if it makes a difference
instructions: Deliberately move for five minutes - twice a day - where breathing in and out through the nose starts to feel effortful - this can be a walk, taking stairs, jumping up and down - whatever it is for five minutes

blocks.label: How do you feel today relative to yesterday?
Where did you do this experiment today?
Who did you do this experiment with today?
blocks.help: We encourage you to do experiments with someone you know

blocks.label: Did you do this experiment indoors or outdoors today?

name: Sitting and Thinking
desc: Try to sit down and think about your thoughts
instructions: Just sit in a particular posture for 4 to 9 mins - this is to get out of the default mode network and build non-verbal awareness. We'll look at a technique called "letting go of thoughts"

blocks.label: Did you notice you were thinking about something?
How many times were you thinking?
Were you able to let go of your thoughts?
Where did you do this experiment today?
Who did you do this experiment with today?
blocks.help: We encourage you to do experiments with someone you know

blocks.label: Did you do this experiment indoors or outdoors today?

name: Listening for 3 minutes
desc: Practice engagement techniques with someone each day, and see if it improves
instructions: Find someone and just listen to them for three minutes. Then reflect on your engagement techniques used.

blocks.label: Which of the following techniques did you use?
How did it feel not interrupting?
Where did you do this experiment today?
Who did you do this experiment with today?
blocks.help: We encourage you to do experiments with someone you know

blocks.label: Did you do this experiment indoors or outdoors today?

name: Kill the alarm
desc: Track your sleep and see if it makes any difference
instructions: "Wake up when you wake up" or "kill the alarm" - try to get a minimum of 7 hours of sleep every day

days.desc: Because this is the first day of the experiment, you only have to plan your sleep for tonight

blocks.label: What time are you sleeping tonight?

days.desc: From today onwards (except the last day), please reflect on your sleep quality last night and plan your sleep for tonight

blocks.label: What time did you wake up today?
How many sleep cycles do you think you got last night?
blocks.help: A sleep cycle lasts for 90 minutes. A person typically goes through multiple cycles during their sleep.

blocks.label: How do you feel today relative to yesterday?
Where did you do this experiment today?
Who did you do this experiment with today?
blocks.help: We encourage you to do experiments with someone you know

What time did you wake up today?
How many sleep cycles do you think you got last night?
blocks.help: A sleep cycle lasts for 90 minutes. A person typically goes through multiple cycles during their sleep.

name: MoveIt
desc: Move intensively for 1 minute several times during the day
instructions: At the start of the week, we will ask you to record your heart rate at rest.

You can then EXPLORE the list (by tapping the action "Try a movement" below) for movements you can get yourself breathing hard (feeling the need to breath in through your mouth) as early into the movement as possible

Do the selected movement 4 to 8 times during the regular day (from the time you start work, till 8 hours later) no more than once and hour, no less than once every two hours within that 8 hour window. (Max dose 8 times within 8 hours)
Please remember: SAFETY FIRST - test these out BEFORE the experiment to see how they feel and where you can do them.

days.desc: Since this is your first day, start by taking your resting heart rate

blocks.label: Your heart rate
Pick a movement from below

movements.name: Hands on knees rapid bodyweight squats
movements.desc: Put your hands on your knees and squat till your bum is level with your knees; use your hands (if you wish) to help push yourself back up to standing; do this move as quickly as possible - which is why using your hands is ok as that will get you breathing harder faster.

movements.name: Up stairs at pace
movements.desc: Go to a lower floor so you have ample stairs for your minute. Notice what floor you start to feel the effects anywhere in your body. if needed for that minute of effort can up intensity by increasing load. Eg, your back pack with a book or your computer in it; taking two steps rather than one (hang onto the banister)

movements.name: Obstacle hops
movements.desc: Put down a pencil, a book, anything (Test this ahead of time) that is low and narrow, and hop over it (both feet together) from one side to the other. This is DEMANDING so please test ahead of time how continuously this is possible to do. Try not to look at your feet - this is similar to skipping without the rope. Note: Do this only once a day

movements.name: Jumping Jacks
movements.desc: An oldy but a goody - and again not recommended more than one of your reps during the day as this is a kind of plyometric or explosive movement. It can be effective because the whole body is in motion.

movements.name: Lunges
movements.desc: Stepping or jumping or blended - back or forward lunging - also side (russian) lunges fine too again, test these out ahead of time to see what works for you and can be sustained for a minute.

movements.name: Mountain Climbers
movements.desc: Hands on ground - one foot forward one foot back; swap front and rear feet as rapidly as possible, with feet spaced as far away from each other as possible. That spacing may begin quite close together, and over the week, get further apart.

movements.name: Hands on knees rapid bodyweight squats
movements.desc: Put your hands on your knees and squat till your bum is level with your knees; use your hands (if you wish) to help push yourself back up to standing; do this move as quickly as possible - which is why using your hands is ok as that will get you breathing harder faster.

Notice what floor you start to feel the effects anywhere in your body. if needed for that minute of effort can up intensity by increasing load. blocks.content: Breath in breath out normally and when ready: exhale, start timer - let the timer run till your FIRST sense of needing to breathe. Stop the timer.
This assessment is NOT about how long you can hold your breath - but when that first bit of AIR HUNGER happens

blocks.label: How do you feel today relative to yesterday?
Where did you do this experiment today?
Who did you do this experiment with today?
blocks.help: We encourage you to do experiments with someone you know

blocks.label: Did you do this experiment indoors or outdoors today?

name: Balance
desc: Pre balance check - Mobility - Post balance check

blocks.content: Do the following, on bare foot, close to a wall or chair in case you need to steady yourself. Check or fill in the boxes to indicate that you have done them.

blocks.label: Feet shoulder with apart with EYES OPEN

blocks.content: Raise LEFT knee so balancing on one foot - count how long you can how your balance (maximum 30)
Do the same on the opposite side

blocks.label: Reset, feet shoulder width apart with EYES CLOSED

blocks.content: Raise LEFT knee so balancing on one foot - count how long you can how your balance (maximum 30)
Do the same on the opposite side
Do the following, on bare foot, close to a wall or chair in case you need to steady yourself. Check or fill in the boxes to indicate that you have done them.

blocks.label: Feet shoulder with apart with EYES OPEN

blocks.content: Raise LEFT knee so balancing on one foot - count how long you can how your balance (maximum 30)
Do the same on the opposite side

blocks.label: Reset, feet shoulder width apart with EYES CLOSED

blocks.content: Raise LEFT knee so balancing on one foot - count how long you can how your balance (maximum 30)
Do the same on the opposite side

blocks.label: How do you feel today relative to yesterday?
What do you notice?
blocks.help: Ideas - what did you notice about the feeling of the OUTSIDE ankle tilts? About the inside ones?

blocks.label: Where did you do this experiment today?
Who did you do this experiment with today?
blocks.help: We encourage you to do experiments with someone you know

blocks.label: Did you do this experiment indoors or outdoors today?

name: Coordinate
desc: Stand to squat to floor to squat to stand
instructions: Pick a time between 3-7 minutes.
Stand to squat to floor to squat to stand - how does this work for you?
The key bits here are to include a squat in each direction - going down and coming up.
It doesnt matter how far into the squat you go; it doesnt matter how many times you do this within the time you set for yourself.
Take as many pauses as you need.
You are exploring how YOU get down and up through the squat - and how as you explore you discover you can make the movement more smooth, continuous, fun.

This movement may be easier or harder depending when in your day you do this, too - so this is about how you feel and what you notice - how easy is one part of the movement? Is getting up easier than coming down? If so do you notice where your legs or back or shoulders or arms are working?

blocks.label: How do you feel today relative to yesterday?
What do you notice?
Where did you do this experiment today?
Who did you do this experiment with today?
blocks.help: We encourage you to do experiments with someone you know

blocks.label: Did you do this experiment indoors or outdoors today?

name: Air Walk
desc: BREATH THROUGH YOUR NOSE while walking.
instructions: In this experiment you BREATH THROUGH YOUR NOSE for 6 minutes while walking.
Each time you do this, you can consider if you are going further or shorter at each level every day - because these experiences are not linear - they can vary and that's ok.
Start the timer and do the following:
- First 3 minutes: Walk at whatever pace is comfortable, and maintain breathing through your nose
- Next 2 minutes: Pick up the pace so you FEEL youre walking - you may need to pay more attention to your pace so you dont fall back to your usual tempo

- Last minute: Walk fast/hard enough to get to the edge of your ability to breath through your nose - you may wish to use a hill or stairs for this if walking fast and staying with nose breathing is too easy. If you are a runner go ahead - hit the gas JUST enough to get to that "I want to breath through my mouth"
If you find yourself breathing through your mouth - think about slowing down your breathing - not taking deep breaths, but SLOW and relaxed breaths

blocks.label: How do you feel today relative to yesterday?
What do you notice?
blocks.help: Ideas - what are you noticing about breathing through your nose? How does it affect your speed? Your heart rate? Any other physical sensations?

blocks.label: Where did you do this experiment today?
Who did you do this experiment with today?
blocks.help: We encourage you to do experiments with someone you know

blocks.label: Did you do this experiment indoors or outdoors today?
